headline.main: Austrian Chancellor: Further Greek Debt Relief Depends on Athens Compromising
headline.print_headline: Austrian Chancellor: Further Greek Debt Relief Depends on Athens Compromising

docs.snippet: Austria's Chancellor Werner Faymann said on Saturday further debt relief for Greece depended on Athens compromising and that a solution had to be found by midnight on Tuesday, when payments to the International Monetary Fund are due....
docs.lead_paragraph: Austria's Chancellor Werner Faymann said on Saturday further debt relief for Greece depended on Athens compromising and that a solution had to be found by midnight on Tuesday, when payments to the International Monetary Fund are due.

headline.main: ECB to Talk on Sunday to Discuss Greek Bank Liquidity-Source
headline.print_headline: ECB to Talk on Sunday to Discuss Greek Bank Liquidity-Source

docs.snippet: The European Central Bank's Governing Council will talk on Sunday about whether to extend emergency liquidity assistance to Greek banks, a person familiar with the matter said on Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank's Governing Council will talk on Sunday about whether to extend emergency liquidity assistance to Greek banks, a person familiar with the matter said on Saturday.

headline.main: Parliament Approves Referendum; Greece's Future in Balance
headline.print_headline: Parliament Approves Referendum; Greece's Future in Balance

docs.snippet: Greece's parliament voted early Sunday in favor of Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras' motion to hold a July 5 referendum on creditor proposals for reforms in exchange for loans, with the country's future in the eurozone looking increasingly shaky....
docs.lead_paragraph: Greece's parliament voted early Sunday in favor of Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras' motion to hold a July 5 referendum on creditor proposals for reforms in exchange for loans, with the country's future in the eurozone looking increasingly shaky.

headline.main: Greek Parliament Gives Green Light to Tspiras' Bailout Referendum
headline.print_headline: Greek Parliament Gives Green Light to Tspiras' Bailout Referendum

docs.snippet: Greek lawmakers on Sunday authorized Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras' proposed July 5th bailout referendum, setting Greece on course for a plebiscite that has enraged international creditors and increased Greece's chances of exiting the euro zone....
docs.lead_paragraph: Greek lawmakers on Sunday authorized Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras' proposed July 5th bailout referendum, setting Greece on course for a plebiscite that has enraged international creditors and increased Greece's chances of exiting the euro zone.

headline.main: ECB's Draghi to Meet Greek Deputy PM on Saturday-Source
headline.print_headline: ECB's Draghi to Meet Greek Deputy PM on Saturday-Source

docs.snippet: Greece's Deputy Prime Minister Yannis Dragasakis will meet European Central Bank President Mario Draghi on Saturday in Brussels to discuss the Greek debt crisis, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters....
docs.lead_paragraph: Greece's Deputy Prime Minister Yannis Dragasakis will meet European Central Bank President Mario Draghi on Saturday in Brussels to discuss the Greek debt crisis, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters.

headline.main: Bill Cosby's Lawyer Says Revealing Court Documents Would Cause 'Embarrassment'
headline.print_headline: Bill Cosby's Lawyer Says Revealing Court Documents Would Cause 'Embarrassment'

docs.snippet: A lawyer for Bill Cosby argued that unsealing court documents from a 2005 Pennsylvania sexual assault case filed against the comedian would cause severe "embarrassment," court records show....
docs.lead_paragraph: A lawyer for Bill Cosby argued that unsealing court documents from a 2005 Pennsylvania sexual assault case filed against the comedian would cause severe "embarrassment," court records show.

headline.main: French Terror Suspect Took Selfie With Beheaded Victim
headline.print_headline: French Terror Suspect Took Selfie With Beheaded Victim

docs.snippet: The top suspect in the beheading of a businessman that French authorities are calling a terrorist attack took a "selfie" photo with the slain victim and sent the image via WhatsApp to a Canadian mobile phone number, officials said Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The top suspect in the beheading of a businessman that French authorities are calling a terrorist attack took a "selfie" photo with the slain victim and sent the image via WhatsApp to a Canadian mobile phone number, officials said Saturday.

headline.main: China Cuts Reserve Requirement Again to Support Growth
headline.print_headline: China Cuts Reserve Requirement Again to Support Growth

docs.snippet: China's central bank on Saturday cut the reserve requirement ratio for certain banks by 50 basis points, a third reduction in nearly 5 months, as it seeks to spur bank lending and combat slowing economic growth....
docs.lead_paragraph: China's central bank on Saturday cut the reserve requirement ratio for certain banks by 50 basis points, a third reduction in nearly 5 months, as it seeks to spur bank lending and combat slowing economic growth.

headline.main: Activists: IS Fighters Kill 200 Civilians in Syrian Town
headline.print_headline: Activists: IS Fighters Kill 200 Civilians in Syrian Town

docs.snippet: Islamic State fighters who launched a surprise attack on a Syrian border town massacred more than 200 civilians, including women and children, before they were killed or driven out by Kurdish forces, activists said on Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Islamic State fighters who launched a surprise attack on a Syrian border town massacred more than 200 civilians, including women and children, before they were killed or driven out by Kurdish forces, activists said on Saturday.
